quiz.text: Two fair dices are thrown. Given that the sum of the dice is less than or equal to 4, find the probability that only one dice shows two.
options: None of these

quiz.text: There are two bags, one of them contains 5 red and 7 white balls and the other contains 3 red and 12 white balls, and a ball is to be drawn from one or the other of the two bags. Find the chance of drawing a red ball.
options: Can’t be determined
None of these

quiz.text: The least chance of drawing a red ball ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: The greatest chance of drawing a red ball ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: If 8 coins are tossed, what is the chance that one and only one will turn up Head ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: A child is asked to pick up 2 balloons from a box containing 10 blue and 15 red balloons. What is the probability of the child picking, at random, 2 balloons of different colours ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: All are cricket balls.
options: None of these

quiz.text: The first is a tennis ball, the second is a cricket ball, the third is a squash ball.
options: None of these

quiz.text: All three are of the same type.
options: None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of number of officers and ladies in the Scorpion Squadron and in the Gunners Squadron are 3 : 1 and 2 : 5 respectively. An individual is selected to be the chairperson of their association. The chance that this individual is selected from Scorpions is 2/3. Find the probability that the chairperson will be an officer.
options: None of these

quiz.text: A speaks the truth 3 out of 4 times, and B 5 out of 6 times. What is the probability that they will contradict each other in stating the same fact?
options: Can’t be determined
None of these

quiz.text: A party of  persons sit at a round table. Find the odds against two specified persons sitting next to each other.
options: Can’t be determined
None of these

quiz.text: If 4 whole numbers are taken at random and multiplied together, what is the chance that the last digit in the product is 1, 3, 7 or 9 ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: In four throws with a pair of dices what is the chance of throwing a double twice?
options: None of these

quiz.text: A locker at the world famous WTC building can be opened by dialing a fixed three-digit code (between 000 and 999). Don, a terrorist, only knows that the number is a three-digit number and has only one six. Using this information he tries to open the locker by dialing three digits at random. The probability that he succeeds in his endeavor is
options: None of these

quiz.text: In a bag there are 12 black and 6 white balls. Two balls are chosen at random and the first one is found to be black. The probability that the second one is also black is :
options: None of these

quiz.text: In a bag there are 12 black and 6 white balls. Two balls are chosen at random and the first one is found to be black. The probability that the second one is white ?
options: None of these

quiz.text: Three of the six vertices of a regular hexagon are chosen at random. The probability that the triangle with these vertices is equilateral is
options: None of these

quiz.text: There are 5 red shoes and 4 black shoes in a sale. They have got all mixed up with each other. What is the probability of getting a matched shoe if two shoes are drawn at random?
options: None of these

quiz.text: A person draws a card from a pack of 52, replaces it and shuffles it. He continues doing it until he draws a heart. What is the probability that he has to make 3 trials?
options: None of these

quiz.text: A fair coin is tossed repeatedly. If Head appears on the first four tosses then the probability of appearance of tail on the fifth toss is
options: None of these

quiz.text: The letters of the word ‘article’ are arranged at random. Find the probability that the vowels may occupy the even places.
options: None of these

quiz.text: What is the probability that four Ss come consecutively in the word MISSISSIPPI?
options: None of these

quiz.text: A team of 4 is to be constituted out of 5 girls and 6 boys. Find the probability that the team may have 3 girls.
options: None of these

quiz.text: 12 persons are seated around a round table. What is the probability that the two particular persons sit together?
options: None of these

quiz.text: Two airplanes I and II bomb a target in succession. The probabilities of I and II scoring a hit correctly are 0.3 and 0.2, respectively. The second plane will bomb only if the first misses the target. The probability that the target is hit by the second plane, is
options: 0.06
0.14
0.32
0.7
None of these

quiz.text: A and B take part in a duel. A can strike with an accuracy of 0.6. B can strike with an accuracy of 0.8. A has the first shot, post which they strike alternately. What is the probability that A wins the duel?
options: 7/10
15/23
2/3
11/17
None of these

quiz.text: A boss decides to distribute Rs. 2000 between 2 employees. He knows X deserves more than Y, but does not know how much more. So he decides to arbitrarily break Rs. 2000 into two parts and give X the bigger part. What is the chance that X gets twice as much as Y or more?
options: 2/5
1/2
1/3
2/3
None of these

quiz.text: Doctors have devised a test for leptospirosis that has the following property: For any person suffering from lepto, there is a 90% chance of the test returning positive. For a person not suffering from lepto, there is an 80% chance of the test returning negative. It is known that 10% of people who go for testing have lepto. If a person who gets tested gets a +ve result for lepto (as in, the test result says they have got lepto), what is the probability that they actually have lepto?
options: 7/10
8/11
1/3
1/2
None of these

quiz.text: Ramesh plans to order a birthday gift for his friend from an online retailer. However, the birthday coincides with the festival season during which there is a huge demand for buying online goods and hence deliveries are often delayed. He estimates that the probability of receiving the gift, in time, from the retailers A, B, C and D would be 0.6, 0.8, 0.9 and 0.5 respectively. Playing safe, he orders from all four retailers simultaneously. What would be the probability that his friend would receive the gift in time?
options: 0.004
0.006
0.216
0.994
0.996

quiz.text: An anti aircraft gun can fire four shots at a time. If the probabilities of the first, second, third and the last shot hitting the enemy aircraft are 0.7, 0.6, 0.5 and 0.4, what is the probability that four shots aimed at an enemy aircraft will bring the aircraft down?
options: 0.084
0.916
0.036
0.964
None of these

125 / 216

quiz.text: Marie is getting married tomorrow, at an outdoor ceremony in the desert. In recent years, it has rained only 5 days each year. Unfortunately, the weatherman has predicted rain for tomorrow. When it actually rains, the weatherman correctly forecasts rain 90 of the times out of 100. When it doesn't rain, he incorrectly forecasts rain 10 of the time. What is the probability that it will rain on the day of Marie's wedding?
options: 0.567
0.111
0.332
0.732
None of these

quiz.text: When three dice are thrown simultaneously, what is the probability that the first die shows up a prime number, the second die shows up an odd number and the third die shows up an odd prime number?
options: None of these

quiz.text: If four dice are thrown simultaneously, what is the probability that the sum of the numbers is exactly 20?
options: None of these

quiz.text: Manimekalai, who is interested in numismatics saw 3 copper coins and 5 gold coins in a box. She drew 2 coins one after the other from the box. What is the probability that the second of the coin she drew was a gold coin when the first drawn is not replaced
options: None of these

quiz.text: There are two bags – one containing 3 one rupee coins, 6 five rupee coins and the other containing 2 one rupee coins, 7 five rupee coins. One bag is chosen at random and from that one coin is drawn at random. What is the probability that it is a 5 rupee coin?
options: None of these
